intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. gracilis, commonly known as slender eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and meadows. Its leaves are lance-shaped and hairy, while its stems are slender and erect. It has been historically used in herbal medicine for its purported eye-health benefits.
